projects.sortina_challenge: Managing shipping rates across multiple regions, transport modes, and contractors was done manually. Rate lookups were slow and error-prone.
projects.sortina_solution: Full-stack platform with role-based access, rate search with multi-criteria filtering, contractor management, multi-currency support, and a complete audit trail.
projects.sortina_result: Running in production. Rate lookups reduced to seconds. Role-based access for the team with full audit logging of every change.
projects.dcc_challenge: Needed a companion computer system for drones running on Raspberry Pi — MAVLink telemetry, computer vision, and reliable remote connectivity through 4G and VPN.
projects.dcc_solution: Web portal on Raspberry Pi 5 connected to PX4 flight controller. MAVLink integration, YOLO-based CV, WiFi scanner, and a relay network with WireGuard VPN over 4G.
projects.dcc_result: Active development with field testing. Web portal running on the drone, relay network providing remote access, multiple systemd services managing the stack.
projects.china-tours_challenge: Needed a platform to present a catalog of Chinese tech companies with ready-made tour programs and a way for clients to submit visit applications.
projects.china-tours_solution: Next.js application with Supabase backend. Company catalog with filters, pre-built tour programs linking to companies, and an application form with admin panel.
projects.china-tours_result: Deployed as MVP. 258 companies in the catalog, multiple tour programs, and a working application pipeline.
projects.mux_challenge: Needed to relay CRSF protocol data from a single RC radio to multiple ELRS TX modules simultaneously, with proper frame routing and timing.
projects.mux_solution: Custom firmware on STM32H743 that parses CRSF frames from the radio input, routes RC channels and service frames (HANDSET, Lua, MSP) to multiple TX module outputs via UART.
projects.mux_result: Active development. CRSF frame parsing and relay working. Published a Saleae Logic protocol analyzer extension for CRSF debugging.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.intro: Essential Hustle ("we", "us", "our") respects your privacy. This policy explains how we collect, use, and protect your information when you visit essentialhustle.dev.
privacy.section1p1: We collect minimal information necessary to operate our website and respond to inquiries:
privacy.section1li1: Contact form submissions: name, email address, and message content — provided voluntarily when you reach out to us.
privacy.section1li2: Anonymous analytics: page views, referrer, browser type, country, and device type — collected via self-hosted Umami Analytics. No cookies, no personal identifiers, no tracking across sites.
privacy.section1li3: Server logs: IP addresses in Nginx access logs, retained for 30 days for security monitoring.
privacy.section2li1: To respond to your contact form inquiries via email.
privacy.section2li2: To improve our website based on anonymous usage patterns.
privacy.section2li3: To monitor and prevent abuse of our services.
privacy.section3p1: We use Umami, a privacy-focused, self-hosted analytics platform. Umami does not use cookies, does not collect personal data, and is fully GDPR compliant. All analytics data is aggregated and anonymous.
privacy.section4p1: Contact form submissions are delivered via email and optionally via Telegram notification. We do not store form data in any database. Analytics data is stored on our self-hosted infrastructure within our private network.
privacy.section5p1: We do not sell, share, or transfer your personal information to third parties. Our website does not load any third-party scripts, trackers, or advertising networks.
privacy.section6p1: You may request deletion of any personal data we hold by contacting us at hello@essentialhustle.dev. Since we store minimal data, in most cases there is nothing to delete beyond email correspondence.
privacy.section7p1: For privacy-related inquiries, contact us at hello@essentialhustle.dev.
